key_points: Abigail Disney, granddaughter of Roy Disney, co-founder of the Walt Disney Company, is advocating for higher taxes on the wealthy.
Throughout her life, Disney has donated $72 million to various causes and is now pushing for a wealth tax.
The COVID-19 pandemic has exacerbated global inequality, with the poor suffering the most, according to Disney.
Disney is part of the Patriotic Millionaires, a group of wealthy individuals advocating for higher taxes on the rich to address inequality.
The group proposes an annual wealth tax starting at 2% for individuals with a net worth over $50 million.
US Senator Elizabeth Warren has proposed a 3% "Ultra-Millionaire Tax Act" on those with more than $1 billion.
Disney discusses the personal challenges and societal implications of inheriting a large fortune.
She argues that being extremely wealthy can lead to a sense of isolation and disconnection from society's broader issues.
Disney believes there should be a cap on personal wealth, suggesting that anything over $1 billion is excessive.
The COVID-19 pandemic has seen billionaire wealth reach a record high of $10.2 trillion, highlighting the growing wealth gap.
spokespersons: Abigail Disney (Heiress to the Disney fortune)
